meanings.definition: The luminous envelope of a star from which its light and heat radiate.
meanings.sent1: The photosphere of a star is like its glowing skin.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the photosphere to learn more about stars.
meanings.sent3: The photosphere of the star seemed to be blushing with warmth.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a photosphere.
meanings.sent5: The photosphere shimmered with a gentle, warm light.

meanings.definition: The visible surface of the sun, lying just above the solar interior and just below the solar atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: Looking at the photosphere of the sun can hurt your eyes.
meanings.sent2: The photosphere of the sun is what we see from Earth.
meanings.sent3: The photosphere of the sun wore a hat made of clouds.
meanings.sent4: The photosphere of the sun was a golden gateway to space.
meanings.sent5: The photosphere of the sun glowed like a golden coin in the sky.
